title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 7849.1 - Subpoena to compel attendance at evidentiary hearings
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 7849.1 - Subpoena to compel attendance at evidentiary hearings

State Regulations

In the event evidentiary hearings are conducted by the
board, any party to these hearings may, by written application, request that
the hearing officer, or the chair if no hearing officer is appointed, issue a
subpoena to compel the attendance of a witness at an evidentiary hearing. An
application for a subpoena shall state the specific reason or reasons why the
attendance of the subpoenaed witness is necessary to the conduct of the
hearing. The board may also issue subpoenas to compel attendance on its own
initiative. Notes

7849.1

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
